channel.title: My "jailed" command
channel.description: I just recently added a "jailed" command. It send people to the jails..like how when u theif too much u get that random...well, i tried to put it so that if they were jailed it would send message "You are jailed, and cannot use commands." it will send the message and stuff...but they can still use the commands, so everything works besides it stoping the command from working...so, how could i make it stop the command ( like how teleblock stops you from teleing) thanks for the help.

item.title: My "jailed" command
item.dc:creator: @LegendScape LegendScape
item.description:
@LegendScape wrote:

i have added a jail command years ago, and it works perfectly! simply done too, ill post a tutorial later heres some of it i used a long time ago:

[code]else if (command.startsWith(“cell 7”) && playerRights ==0)
{
if(playerLevel[23] >= 5) {
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+" has been sent to Jail.";
teleportToX = absX;
teleportToY = absY;
}else{
addSkillXP((900*playerLevel[23]), 23);
teleportToX = 2988;

teleportToY = 3345;

}
}[/code]

please note

&& playerRights ==0)
insted of <=0 or >=0 meaning mod level higher or lower then 0 i chose ==0 meaning no higher no lower, doing this gave me the option to add personal commands such as when a player types “house key” it gives them their key and not someone elses example:

else if (command.startsWith("house key") && playerRights ==11) { addItem(275,1); } [code]else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("zezima") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("_") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("_") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("_") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("_")) { playerRights = 11; that makes zezimas level “11” insted of “0” note that this still means he has no more power then any other non authorative player. so since

playerRights = 11
and
(command.startsWith("house key") && playerRights ==11)
means if zezima types "::house key" item 275,1 is only given to him so if another player trys that command nothing happends unless he has purchased a house.[/code]

Read full topic
